docs.lead_paragraph: With Spain’s ongoing economic crisis leaving local governments in debt and businesses struggling, workers sometimes have to resort to legal measures simply to be paid.

headline.seo: In Spain, Having a Job No Longer Guarantees a Paycheck
headline.main: For Spaniards, Having a Job No Longer Guarantees a Paycheck
headline.print_headline: For Spaniards, Having a Job No Longer Guarantees a Paycheck

docs.abstract: Workers in Spain can no longer count on being paid for their labors as country struggles through fourth year of economic crisis; regional and municipal governments are deeply in debt and even government workers are finding themselves without paychecks; most workers believe they have no choice but to keep their jobs, learning to manage on occasional checks and partial payments on random dates, until economy improves.
docs.snippet: With Spain’s ongoing economic crisis leaving local governments in debt and businesses struggling, workers sometimes have to resort to legal measures simply to be paid.

docs.lead_paragraph: Now, for a little perspective on the scary deficit.
docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column disputes misconception that trillion-dollar deficit poses grave risk to American economy; contends that hyped-up talk about deficits is disingenuous attempt to scare and bully body politic into abandoning programs that shield both poor and middle-class Americans from harm.
docs.snippet: Now, for a little perspective on the scary deficit.

docs.lead_paragraph: The couple is married in Philadelphia.
docs.snippet: The couple is married in Philadelphia.

docs.lead_paragraph: Well-trained health care workers can do some jobs as well or better, and for much less money.

headline.seo: When the Doctor Is Not Needed
headline.main: When the Doctor Is Not Needed
headline.print_headline: When the Doctor Is Not Needed

docs.abstract: Editorial highlights initiatives across country that use non-doctors to provide medical care, which address both shortage of doctors and rising costs of health care.
docs.snippet: Well-trained health care workers can do some jobs as well or better, and for much less money.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The projected growth of Medicare costs is the single biggest contributor to the country’s long-term budget deficits, many estimates show. No cohort of Americans, with the possible exception of the very affluent, pays enough in Medicare taxes and premiums to cover its eventual Medicare costs.

headline.main: Foreseeing the Issues in Medicare’s Future

docs.abstract: In the current fiscal talks, Republicans are pushing for significant changes to Medicare, while Democrats are arguing that it is not the most pressing budget problem.
docs.snippet: In the current fiscal talks, Republicans are pushing for significant changes to Medicare, while Democrats are arguing that it is not the most pressing budget problem.

headline.main: Further Notes on ONE TRILLION DOLLARS

docs.lead_paragraph: AARP has returned to a hard-line position of opposing any Medicare or Social Security cutbacks and is waging a major campaign, partly to prove its worth to members.

headline.seo: AARP Returns to a Hard Line Against Benefit Cutbacks
headline.main: With a Major Push, AARP Returns to a Hard Line Against Cuts in Benefits
headline.print_headline: With a Major Push, AARP Returns to a Hard Line Against Cuts in Benefits

docs.abstract: AARP veers back to hard-line position of opposing any cutbacks in Medicare or Social Security and is seeking to keep those programs off bargaining table in deficit deal negotiations; group angered members in 2011 by agreeing to possibility of accepting modest cuts in Social Security benefits.
docs.snippet: AARP has returned to a hard-line position of opposing any Medicare or Social Security cutbacks and is waging a major campaign, partly to prove its worth to members.

docs.lead_paragraph: The failure to file plans was a setback to President Obama’s hopes that Republicans would join a campaign to provide health insurance to all Americans.

headline.main: Most Governors Refuse to Set Up Health Exchanges
headline.print_headline: Majority of Governors Refuse To Set Up Health Exchanges

docs.abstract: More than half of America's states have rejected federal government's pleas to set up their own health insurance exchanges; action is setback to Pres Obama’s hopes that Republicans would join White House campaign to provide health insurance to all Americans.
docs.snippet: The failure to file plans was a setback to President Obama’s hopes that Republicans would join a campaign to provide health insurance to all Americans.
